intro: Calamintha nepeta var. canescens, commonly known as woolly betony, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its grayish-white, hairy foliage and clusters of small, pale blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained, sunny soils. Its aromatic leaves contain essential oils, which contribute to its use in traditional herbal remedies. It is also valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
